infobox.Japanese title:: 乱歩邸殺人事件  (Ranpo-tei Satsujin Jiken)
infobox.Cast:: Conan Edogawa  Detective Boys  Ai Haibara  Sumiko Kobayashi  Wataru Takagi  Miwako Sato
infobox.Animation director:: 1142:  • Kosei Takahashi  • Eiichi Tokura  • Banshanmen  1143:  • Keiko Sasaki
infobox.Character design:: Masatomo Sudo  Masanori Hashimoto (sub-character)  Hiroshi Ogawa (design works)
infobox.Voice Cast::
Voice Cast:



Minami Takayama as Conan Edogawa  Yukiko Iwai as Ayumi Yoshida  Wataru Takagi as Genta Kojima, Wataru Takagi  Ikue Otani as Mitsuhiko Tsuburaya  Megumi Hayashibara as Ai Haibara  Yuko Kato as Sumiko Kobayashi  Atsuko Yuya as Miwako Sato  Toru Furusawa as Professor Goto  Yasuhiro Fujiwara as Ryosuke Okamoto  Mariko Kouda as Nanako Imai  Sumomo Momomori as Rika Tajima  Riki Kagami as Shunji Oguruma  Akinori Egoshi as Ken Mizohata  Masumi Tazawa as Mizumori

sections.Situation: The Detective Boys, including Conan, accompanied by their teacher Miss Kobayashi, visit the Rampo residence. The storehouse which Rampo used as a library entailed a great deal of valuable books, stimulating the excitement of Conan and the rest. In the meantime, Detective Sato and Detective Takagi arrive, whereupon they are informed that a murder case has taken place in a nearby park. And - what is more - the victim's belongings seem to be related to the storehouse that was often closed to the public... The modern-day Detective Boys shall challenge this difficult case!

sections.Trivia:
- Excluding the remake of Moonlight Sonata Murder Case (episodes 1000-1001), this is the first time in 24 years that the episode title ends with "Murder Case" (殺人事件 ,Satsujin Jiken?)[N 1]. It is worth noting that The Spirit Detective's Murder (霊魂探偵殺害事件 ,Reikon Tantei Satsugai Jiken?) (episodes 863-864), which aired in 2017, uses "satsugai jiken" which also means "murder case"
- This case features a different Joke Card of Conan impersonating the pose of Edogawa Rampo.
- Many famous mystery books are exhibited on Rampo's bookshelf:

- This is Sumiko Kobayashi's sixth appearance in anime-original episodes. Precisely, the protagonist of Edogawa Rampo's Detective Boys from Kogoro Akechi series also shares the same surname: Yoshio Kobayashi (小林 芳雄).
